p: Morus alba Linn ( M. alba), also known as white mulberry, belongs to the Moraceae family [ 1]. It is a small deciduous tree cultivated in various tropical, subtropical, and temperate countries, including China, Japan, Korea, Thailand, Indonesia, India, Vietnam, Brazil, Africa, and others [ 2, 3]. Many traditional medicines incorporate M. alba fruit, leaves, roots, branches, and bark in Ayurveda medication systems due to their health benefits and antioxidants [ 4].
